body_html:
This will not work, if some variable (mu in this case) should be initialized depending on a placeholder.

I'd like to train mu further after initializing, so I either have to get tf.reduce_mean produce an optimizable variable or I have to create a new tf.variable and initialize it with tf.reduce_mean like in this example.
body_text:
This will not work, if some variable (mu in this case) should be initialized depending on a placeholder.
I'd like to train mu further after initializing, so I either have to get tf.reduce_mean produce an optimizable variable or I have to create a new tf.variable and initialize it with tf.reduce_mean like in this example.
body:
This will not work, if some variable (`mu` in this case) should be initialized depending on a placeholder.

I'd like to train `mu` further after initializing, so I either have to get `tf.reduce_mean` produce an optimizable variable or I have to create a new `tf.variable` and initialize it with `tf.reduce_mean` like in this example.
